summary: Email chain between attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP and federal prosecutors regarding a grand jury subpoena issued on July 5, 2019. The correspondence discusses scheduling meetings, providing transcripts and evidence, and mentions a client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) and evidence of phone contacts with underage girls.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.context: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP representing a client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in response to a grand jury subpoena. She coordinates meetings with prosecutors and confirms legal representation.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.context: Associate at Winston & Strawn LLP working with Suzanne Bloom on the case. She assists with scheduling and correspondence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in reference to civil cases involving him in federal court in Florida. His name appears in the context of ongoing litigation.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of a client in response to a grand jury subpoena.
Bloom is confirmed as formally retained to represent the client in connection with the grand jury subpoena. The client is referenced in discussions about a voluntary interview.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: SDNY grand jury subpoena issued, likely to Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated in the email subject lines.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Initial date for grand jury appearance as per subpoena, which was adjourned and held in abeyance.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: Defense attorneys Bloom and Hudgens schedule a meeting with federal prosecutors to discuss the case.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued by the SDNY on July 5, 2019, likely to Ghislaine Maxwell, as her attorneys are corresponding about it.
Prosecutors mention they have contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls at the time of the calls.
The defense and prosecution are negotiating a potential voluntary interview with the client, with the grand jury appearance date adjourned.
Multiple civil cases involving Jeffrey Epstein are referenced, including specific docket numbers in SDNY and Florida.
Email correspondence shows coordination between defense attorneys Suzanne Bloom and Johanna Hudgens and federal prosecutors regarding evidence and meetings.
